CatDescriptText: Mr. Hezekiah Mickey, 2507 Bedford Dwellings, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �No I don�t. The public bore the load during the recent strike and the recent raise in fares.  Therefore, I think that it�s unfair for the company to force more of a load on the people.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Hezekiah Mickey, wearing eyeglasses, light colored trench coat with lapels, and hat with dark band, standing in front of light colored marble wall,  left store window displaying mens dress shirts and neckties, right store window displaying female undergarments,
